long_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial Comparing Water Vapour Thermal Therapy (Rezūm) and TURP in Men With Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia in Refractory Urinary Retention
prior_treatment_requirements: * Refractory urinary retention related to benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH)
* On urethral Foley's catheter before treatment
Exclude - * Past or current history of prostate cancer
Exclude - * Strong suspicion of prostate cancer (e.g. Elevated PSA before urinary retention or abnormal prostate on DRE without workup for prostate cancer)
Exclude - * Known Urethral stricture / Bladder stone / Hypocontractile bladder
Exclude - * Known neurological diseases which may affect bladder function (e.g. Parkinsonism, stroke)

Exclude - * Contraindicated to undergo TURP or REZUM (e.g. not fit for GA/SA, active urinary tract infection, fail to be placed in lithotomy position, uncorrectable coagulopathy, antiplatelet or anticoagulant which cannot be stopped)
short_title: Comparing Water Vapour Thermal Therapy (Rezūm) and TURP
summary: This is a randomized controlled trial using a non-inferiority design with the subjects randomized 1:1 to either water vapour thermal treatment (REZUM) arm or transurethral resection of prostate (TURP) arm.
